titles.title: To amend title 10, United States Code, to require the consent of a member of the Armed Forces before administering the member with an investigational new drug or drug unapproved for its applied use.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary: 11/18/1999--Introduced. Prohibits the Secretary of Defense from administering to a member of the armed forces an investigational new drug or drug unapproved for its applied use without the consent of the member.Repeals provisions concerning a limitation and waiver of current notice requirements relating to the administering of such drugs.
